cab.content: Circulated by the Secretary of State for India with reference to Minute 16 of Meeting 175 of War Cabinet. mc-3rkr&&i - I From Viceroy, Foreign Department, 4th July 1917. (Repeated to Aden.) (Received at India Office, 8 p.m.) Secret. Hodeida. Reference to Naval Oommander-in-Chief s telegram153 of 1st July to the Lords Commissioners of the Admiralty. We desire to protest emphatically against the bombardment of Hodeidawithout our being previously consulted. Apart from the deplorable positionin which this action leaves the British subjects in Hodeida, we feel seriousmisgivings as to its effect on Aden Hinterland generally, and in particular onImam who, as we know, is extremely sensitive regarding Hodeida. We trustthat instructions may be issued to Admiral invariably to consult us beforeundertaking operations of this kind in areas under our political control. -
